main.docTitle: Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (Safety and Survey) Regulation

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Regulation, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: agent (代理人), in relation to the owner of a local vessel, means a person appointed by the owner as his agent under section 4;

def.name: CategoryAVessel
def.leadIn: Category A vessel (A類船隻) means a local vessel that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of a class and type specified in columns 1 and 2 of Schedule 1; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: categorized as a Category A vessel in column 3 of Schedule 1;

def.name: CategoryBVessel
def.leadIn: Category B vessel (B類船隻) means a local vessel that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of a class and type specified in columns 1 and 2 of Schedule 1; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: categorized as a Category B vessel in column 3 of Schedule 1;

section.def: certificate of inspection (檢查證明書) means a certificate of inspection issued under section 19(2);
certificate of survey (驗船證明書) means a certificate of survey issued under section 24(1);
Certification and Licensing Regulation (《證明書及牌照規例》) means the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (Certification and Licensing) Regulation (Cap. 548 sub. leg. D);
class (類別), in relation to a local vessel, means a class of local vessel specified in column 1 of Schedule 1 to the Certification and Licensing Regulation;
Class I vessel (第I類別船隻) means a local vessel that is certificated for Class I under the Certification and Licensing Regulation;
Class II vessel (第II類別船隻) means a local vessel that is certificated for Class II under the Certification and Licensing Regulation;
Class III vessel (第III類別船隻) means a local vessel that is certificated for Class III under the Certification and Licensing Regulation;
Class IV vessel (第IV類別船隻) means a local vessel that is certificated for Class IV under the Certification and Licensing Regulation;

def.name: CompetentSurveyor
def.leadIn: competent surveyor (合資格驗船師), in relation to the carrying out of any survey or the approval of any plan of any local vessel, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized surveyor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a recognized authority;

section.def: conditions of assignment (勘定條件) means the requirements of the Load Lines Convention that relate to the assignment of freeboard; (L.N. 44 of 2018)
declaration of fitness (適合運載危險品聲明) means a declaration of fitness for the carriage of dangerous goods issued under section 54 or 65(4);
FA certificate (乾舷勘定證明書) means a freeboard assignment certificate issued under section 46 or 65(4);
HKLL certificate (香港載重線證明書) means a Hong Kong load line certificate issued under section 46 or 65(4);

def.name: Length
def.leadIn: length (長度) or the symbol (L), in relation to a local vessel, means the greater of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the distance between the foreside of the stem and the axis of the rudder stock;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 96% of the distance between the foreside of the stem and the aftside of the stern,

def.continued: measured on a waterline at 85% of the least moulded depth, except that—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the vessel has a rake of keel, the waterline on which the distance is measured shall be parallel to the designed waterline; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the vessel is not fitted with a rudder stock, the length shall be determined in accordance with paragraph (b);

section.def: Load Lines Convention (《載重線公約》) means the International Convention on Load Lines signed in London on 5 April 1966, or any convention that replaces that Convention or any successor convention, as amended from time to time and as applicable to Hong Kong; (10 of 2009 s. 51 and E.R. 5 of 2021)

Marine Department Notice (海事處佈告) means a notice issued by the Director which is described as such, and any reference to a particular Marine Department Notice includes a reference to that Notice as amended from time to time by a subsequent Marine Department Notice;

def.name: MouldedDepth
def.leadIn: moulded depth (型深), in relation to a local vessel, means the vertical distance measured from the top of the keel to the top of the freeboard deck beam at side, except that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the vessel is a wood or composite vessel, it shall be measured from the lower edge of the keel rabbet;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the form at the lower part of the midship section of the vessel is of a hollow character, or if thick garboards are fitted, it shall be measured from the point where the line of the flat of the bottom continued inwards cuts the side of the keel;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: if the freeboard deck of the vessel is stepped and the raised part of the deck extends over the point at which the moulded depth is to be determined, it shall be measured to a line of reference extending from the lower part of the deck along a line parallel to the raised part of the deck;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that has never been licensed under Part IV of the Shipping and Port Control Ordinance (Cap. 313) before the commencement date* of this Regulation; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in respect of which an application for an operating licence is made for the first time on or after the commencement date of this Regulation, but does not include a vessel the keel of which is laid, or which is at a similar stage of construction, within 12 months immediately before that date and is still under construction on that date;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a local vessel that does not fall within paragraph (a) and undergoes, on or after the commencement date of this Regulation, alteration—

subparagraph.name: A
B
subparagraph.leadIn: the output of its main propulsion engine so that—

subparagraph.name: I
subparagraph.content: the output is increased by 10% or more than what is recorded in its certificate of inspection or certificate of survey; or

subparagraph.name: II
subparagraph.content: particulars relating to the materials, scantlings or design of the propulsion shafting or stern tube, as shown in the plans approved under Part 3, are no longer accurate; or

subparagraph.name: C
ii
subparagraph.leadIn: to an extent that it is no longer suitable—

subparagraph.name: A
B
subparagraph.content: to be categorized as a Category A vessel or a Category B vessel;

section.def: plan (圖則) includes drawings, diagrams and calculations; (L.N. 70 of 2020)
prescribed fee (訂明費用), in relation to any matter, means the fee prescribed for that matter in the regulation made under section 88 of the Ordinance;
recognized authority (獲承認的當局) means a government authority recognized under section 7A of the Ordinance;

def.name: RiverTradeLimits
def.leadIn: river trade limits (內河航限) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the waters in the vicinity of Hong Kong within the following boundaries—

subparagraph.content: to the East, meridian 114°30´ East;
to the South, parallel 22°09´ North; and
to the West, meridian 113°31´ East; and (L.N. 127 of 2024)

paragraph.name: b

section.def: SOLAS Convention (《人命安全公約》) means the International Convention for the Safety of Life at Sea signed in London on 1 November 1974, or any convention that replaces that Convention or any successor convention, as amended from time to time and as applicable to Hong Kong; (10 of 2009 s. 51 and E.R. 5 of 2021)
specified sheltered waters (指明遮蔽水域) means the waters specified in Schedule 2 to the Certification and Licensing Regulation; (E.R. 4 of 2024)
survey record of safety equipment (安全設備檢驗紀錄) means the survey record of safety equipment issued under section 39 or 65(4);
type (類型), in relation to a local vessel, means a type of local vessel specified in column 2 of Schedule 1 to the Certification and Licensing Regulation;
typhoon shelter (避風塘) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (Typhoon Shelters) Regulation (Cap. 548 sub. leg. E); (L.N. 154 of 2019)
Victoria port (維多利亞港口) means the area of the waters of Hong Kong declared under section 56 of the Shipping and Port Control Ordinance (Cap. 313) as Victoria port.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application
section.content: This Regulation applies to local vessels to which Part IV of the Ordinance applies.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Appointment and Termination of Appointment of Agent

section.name: s4
section.heading: Appointment of agent

subsection.content: The owner of a local vessel may appoint another person as his agent for the purposes of this Regulation.

subsection.leadIn: Where the owner of a local vessel has appointed an agent, he shall, within 14 days after the appointment, deliver to the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice of appointment that complies with subsection (3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a certified copy of the document of identification of the agent.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of appointment shall contain the following particulars—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the local vessel concerned, if any;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a certificate of ownership is in force in respect of the vessel, the number of the certificate;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name, telephone number and address in Hong Kong of the owner of the vessel;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the name, telephone number and address in Hong Kong of the agent;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a statement by the owner that he has appointed the agent for the purposes of this Regulation;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a statement by the agent that he has accepted the appointment to be the agent of the owner for the purposes of this Regulation;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the date of appointment;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the signature or, if applicable, the company seal of the owner; and

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the signature or, if applicable, the company seal of the agent.

def.name: DocumentOfIdentification
def.leadIn: In this section, document of identification (身分證明文件) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to an individual who holds a valid identity card, the identity card;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a company as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622), the certificate of incorporation issued in respect of the company under the Ordinance under which the company was formed and registered; or (28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to a registered non-Hong Kong company as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622), the certificate of registration issued in respect of the company under the Ordinance under which the company was registered as a registered non-Hong Kong company. (28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

section.name: s5
section.heading: Owner of local vessel or his agent to notify change in particulars

subsection.content: If there is any change in a particular given under section 4(3), the owner of the local vessel concerned or his agent shall, within 14 days after the change, give a written notice of it to the Director.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Termination of appointment of agent

subsection.content: Where the appointment of an agent is terminated for any reason, both the owner of the local vessel concerned and the agent shall immediately give a written notice of the termination to the Director.
A notice given under subsection (1) shall be signed by or stamped with the company seal of (as may be appropriate) the person who gives the notice.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Application of Part 3

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), this Part applies to a local vessel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is a new vessel; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in respect of which an application is made for the first time for approval of plans with a view to apply for any of the following items—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a certificate of inspection;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a certificate of survey;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a survey record of safety equipment;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a HKLL certificate;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: a FA certificate; or

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: a declaration of fitness.

subsection.leadIn: This Part does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Class II vessel that falls within Schedule 2;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a Class III vessel (including a Class III vessel that falls within Schedule 2) unless it is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a fish carrier that is a Category A vessel;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a fishing sampan made of glass reinforced plastic; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a fishing vessel that is a Category A vessel; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (3), a Class IV vessel.

subsection.leadIn: This Part applies to a Class IV vessel that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: licensed to carry more than 60 passengers;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: licensed to carry not more than 60 passengers but is let for hire or reward, except a vessel that also falls within paragraph (ba), (bb), (c) or (d); (L.N. 70 of 2020)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: not less than 24 metres in length, of not more than 150 gross tonnage and licensed for the first time on or after 1 August 2020, except a vessel that also falls within paragraph (d); (L.N. 70 of 2020)

paragraph.name: bb
paragraph.content: not less than 24 metres in length, of more than 150 gross tonnage and licensed for the first time on or after 1 August 2020; (L.N. 70 of 2020)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: of more than 150 gross tonnage and licensed before 1 August 2020; or (L.N. 70 of 2020)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: of novel construction.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Approval of plans upon application

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the Director or a competent surveyor may, upon application, approve plans relating to a local vessel in accordance with this Part.

subsection.leadIn: Plans relating to a Class IV vessel that falls within section 7(3)(b) or (ba) shall be approved— (L.N. 70 of 2020)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by a competent surveyor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the Director so directs in any particular case, by the Director.

subsection.content: Where the Director directs under subsection (2)(b) that the plans shall be approved by him, an application shall be made to the Director under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: The following provisions apply in relation to an application made to the Director under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the application shall be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: plans that have to be approved under section 9(1), (2), (3) or (4) may be submitted separately;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: approval of plans under more than one subsection of section 9 may be applied for in a single application;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: 3 copies of each of the plans to be approved shall be submitted; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: the applicant shall, at the request of the Director, pay the prescribed fee for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: considering the plans; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the plans are approved, the approval of the plans.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by a written notice to an applicant, require the applicant to provide such information that the Director considers necessary for determining the application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse to proceed with the application if the applicant fails to comply with the notice.

subsection.content: Where an application is made to a competent surveyor under subsection (1), the applicant shall, as soon as practicable after engaging the surveyor and in any event before any plans are submitted to the surveyor, notify the Director of the engagement in the specified form.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Plans shall be approved before issue of certificates, etc.

subsection.leadIn: No certificate of inspection or certificate of survey shall be issued in respect of a local vessel that falls within section 7(1)(a) or (b)(i) or (ii) unless plans relating to the following parts or aspects of the vessel, in so far as they are applicable, have been approved under this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: general arrangements;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: tonnage measurements and calculations;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: structures and scantlings;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: freeboard calculations;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: arrangements relating to watertightness, weathertightness, bulkheads, hatchways, coamings, side scuttles, air vents, freeing ports, scuppers, inlets and discharges;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: stability;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: accommodation layouts;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: passenger space, seating arrangements, number of passengers and escape routes;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: fuel, machinery, shafting and electrical systems;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: safety equipment including life-saving appliances, fire-fighting apparatus and emergency controls;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: structural fire protection;

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: navigational and communication equipment including lights, shapes and sound signals;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: lifting appliances;

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: prevention and control of pollution; and

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: measures against potential hazards to the safety of the vessel and any person or property on board the vessel.

subsection.leadIn: No survey record of safety equipment shall be issued in respect of a local vessel that falls within section 7(1)(a) or (b)(iii) unless plans relating to the following parts or aspects of the vessel, in so far as they are applicable, have been approved under this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: general arrangements;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: stability;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: safety equipment including life-saving appliances, fire-fighting apparatus and emergency controls;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: navigational and communication equipment including lights, shapes and sound signals; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: emergency electrical systems.

subsection.leadIn: No HKLL certificate or FA certificate shall be issued in respect of a local vessel that falls within section 7(1)(a) or (b)(iv) or (v) unless plans relating to the following parts or aspects of the vessel, in so far as they are applicable, have been approved under this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: general arrangements;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: structures and scantlings;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: conditions of assignment;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: freeboard calculations; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: stability.

subsection.leadIn: No declaration of fitness shall be issued in respect of a local vessel that falls within section 7(1)(a) or (b)(vi) unless plans relating to the following parts or aspects of the vessel, in so far as they are applicable, have been approved under this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: general arrangements;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: electrical systems, installations and equipment;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: safety equipment including life-saving appliances, fire-fighting apparatus and emergency controls;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: structural fire protection; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: measures against potential hazards to the safety of the vessel and any person or property on board the vessel.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Determination of applications made to Director

subsection.leadIn: After considering an application made under section 8(1) for approval of any plan, the Director may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: approve the plan;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: approve the plan subject to any reasonable conditions or alterations that he may endorse on the plan;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: refuse to approve the plan; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: temporarily withhold the approval of the plan.

subsection.content: The Director shall only approve a plan if he is satisfied that the local vessel concerned or any part of it, if built or arranged in accordance with the plan, will comply with the requirements under this Regulation for the issue of the certificate, record or declaration in respect of which approval of such plan is required under section 9.

subsection.leadIn: Upon approving a plan, the Director shall, in respect of each copy of the plan submitted to him, endorse and sign on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: every page of the plan; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the plan includes any booklet, a conspicuous part of the booklet.

subsection.leadIn: The following particulars shall be entered in the plan and booklet referred to in subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the public officer to whom the power to approve the plan is delegated under section 72 of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the rank of the public officer; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the date of approval.

subsection.content: The Director shall retain one copy of each plan approved by him and forward the other 2 copies to the applicant.

subsection.leadIn: Within 7 days after refusing to approve a plan under subsection (1)(c), the Director shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give a written notice of the refusal to the applicant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state in such notice the reasons for the refusal.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Approval of re-submitted plans

subsection.leadIn: Within 7 days after deciding to temporarily withhold the approval of a plan under section 10(1)(d), the Director shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give a written notice of the decision to the applicant; and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the reasons for the decision; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the requirements as regards rendering the plan fit for re-submission for approval.

subsection.content: An applicant to whom a notice is given under subsection (1) may, when he considers the requirements stated in the notice have been complied with, apply to the Director for approval of the re-submitted plan.

subsection.leadIn: An application made under subsection (2) shall be in the specified form and the applicant shall, at the request of the Director, pay the prescribed fee for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: considering the re-submitted plan; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the re-submitted plan is approved, the approval of the plan.

subsection.leadIn: If the Director is satisfied that the requirements stated in a notice given under subsection (1) have been complied with, he shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: approve the re-submitted plan; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: approve the re-submitted plan subject to any reasonable conditions or alterations that he may endorse on the plan.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Determination of applications made to competent surveyor

subsection.content: Where an application is made to a competent surveyor under section 8(1), he shall only approve the plan if he is satisfied that the local vessel concerned or any part of it, if built or arranged in accordance with the plan, will comply with the requirements under this Regulation for the issue of the certificate, record or declaration in respect of which approval of such plan is required under section 9.

subsection.leadIn: Upon approving a plan, a competent surveyor shall, in respect of each copy of the plan submitted to him, endorse and sign on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: every page of the plan; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the plan includes any booklet, a conspicuous part of the booklet.

subsection.leadIn: The following particulars shall be entered in the plan and booklet referred to in subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the competent surveyor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the plan is approved by a recognized authority, the name of the individual who is authorized to approve the plan for and on behalf of the authority;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the post title of the individual referred to in paragraph (b); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the date of approval.

subsection.content: The competent surveyor shall retain at least one copy of each plan approved by him and forward the other copies to the applicant.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Preparation of declaration of plan approval under Part 3

subsection.content: This section applies to any plan relating to a local vessel that has been approved by a competent surveyor under this Part, except plans relating to a Class IV vessel that falls within section 7(3)(b) or (ba). (L.N. 70 of 2020)
A competent surveyor who has approved a plan shall submit a declaration of plan approval to the Director within 14 days after the date of approval.
A declaration of plan approval shall be in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: If a plan approved by a competent surveyor relates to any of the following parts or aspects of a local vessel, he shall submit a copy of the plan together with the declaration of plan approval to the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: general arrangements;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: tonnage measurements and calculations;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: freeboard calculations;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: stability;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: passenger space, seating arrangements, number of passengers and escape routes;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: fuel systems;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: safety equipment including life-saving appliances, fire-fighting apparatus and emergency controls;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: structural fire protection;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: navigational and communication equipment including lights, shapes and sound signals;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: prevention and control of pollution; and

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: measures against potential hazards to the safety of the vessel and any person or property on board the vessel.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Director may require approved plans be amended

subsection.content: This section applies to any plan relating to a local vessel that has been approved by the Director or a competent surveyor under this Part.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may, at any time before he issues the certificate, record or declaration in respect of which any plan is approved under this Part, require—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the plan be amended in such manner as he considers appropriate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amended plan be submitted for further approval by the Director, or the competent surveyor who is initially engaged to approve the plan.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Director requires an amended plan be submitted to him for further approval, the applicant who made the initial application for approval of plan under section 8(1) shall, at the request of the Director, pay the prescribed fee for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: considering the amended plan; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the amended plan is approved, the approval of the plan.

subsection.content: The owner of the local vessel concerned or his agent shall ensure that the vessel is built or arranged in accordance with the amended plan.

section.name: s14A
section.heading: Plans to be kept on board

subsection.content: One set of the plans of a local vessel that are approved under this Part must at all times be kept on board the vessel.

subsection.leadIn: If a local vessel is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Class I vessel that is licensed to carry more than 100 passengers; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a Class IV vessel that is licensed to carry more than 100 passengers,

subsection.continued: the vessel’s plans referred to in subsection (1) (except plans containing information on the vessel’s stability) must at all times be displayed in a conspicuous place on the vessel.

subsection.content: If, without reasonable excuse, subsection (1) or (2) is contravened, the owner of the local vessel, the owner’s agent and the coxswain of the vessel each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), the plans of a local vessel include plans that contain the following information in so far as such information is applicable to the vessel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the general arrangements of the vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the vessel is involved in the carriage of passengers, the seating arrangements and escape routes;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the types and dispositions of life-saving appliances, fire-fighting apparatus, lights and sound signals;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the stability information of the vessel;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: instructions to be followed in the case of an emergency.

part.name: P4
part.heading: Certificate of Inspection and Certificate of Survey

section.name: s15
section.heading: Application of Part 4

subsection.leadIn: This Part does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Class II vessel or a Class III vessel that falls within Schedule 2; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (2), a Class IV vessel.

subsection.leadIn: This Part applies to a Class IV vessel that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: licensed to carry more than 60 passengers;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: licensed to carry not more than 60 passengers but is let for hire or reward, except a vessel that also falls within paragraph (ba), (bb), (c) or (d); (L.N. 70 of 2020)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: not less than 24 metres in length, of not more than 150 gross tonnage and licensed for the first time on or after 1 August 2020, except a vessel that also falls within paragraph (d); (L.N. 70 of 2020)

paragraph.name: bb
paragraph.content: not less than 24 metres in length, of more than 150 gross tonnage and licensed for the first time on or after 1 August 2020; (L.N. 70 of 2020)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: of more than 150 gross tonnage and licensed before 1 August 2020; or (L.N. 70 of 2020)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: of novel construction.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Offence for operating local vessel without certificate of inspection or certificate of survey

subsection.leadIn: A local vessel shall not be operated unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a Class IV vessel that falls within section 15(2)(b) or (ba), a certificate of inspection; or (L.N. 70 of 2020)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of any other local vessel, a certificate of survey,

subsection.continued: is in force in respect of the vessel.

subsection.content: If, without reasonable excuse, subsection (1) is contravened, the owner of the local vessel concerned, his agent and the coxswain each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Application for survey under Part 4

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the Director or a competent surveyor may, upon an application by the owner of a local vessel or his agent, carry out a survey of the vessel in order that a certificate of inspection or certificate of survey may be issued in respect of the vessel.

subsection.leadIn: A survey of a Class IV vessel that falls within section 15(2)(b) or (ba) shall be carried out— (L.N. 70 of 2020)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by a competent surveyor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the Director so directs in any particular case, by the Director.

subsection.content: Where the Director directs under subsection (2)(b) that a survey shall be carried out by him, the owner of the vessel or his agent shall make an application to the Director under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: The following provisions apply in relation to an application made to the Director under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the application shall be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the applicant shall, at the request of the Director, pay the prescribed fee for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the survey; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if a certificate of inspection or certificate of survey is issued, the issue of the certificate.

subsection.content: Where an application is made to a competent surveyor under subsection (1), the applicant shall, as soon as practicable after engaging the surveyor and in any event before the survey is carried out, notify the Director of the engagement in the specified form.
Subsection (5) does not apply to a survey of a Class IV vessel that falls within section 15(2)(b) or (ba). (L.N. 70 of 2020)

section.name: s18
section.heading: Matters to be surveyed under Part 4

subsection.content: A certificate of inspection or certificate of survey shall only be issued in respect of a local vessel if the vessel is fit for the service intended and in good condition.

subsection.leadIn: In determining whether a local vessel is fit for the service intended and in good condition, the Director or the competent surveyor who carries out the survey shall, in addition to any other matters that he considers relevant, have regard to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the vessel’s compliance with requirements stated in the following provisions or regulations in so far as they are applicable—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: section 31;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: section 32(1) and (2);

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: section 33(1) and (2);

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: section 69 or 70;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: section 76 or 77;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: section 80;

subparagraph.name: 6a
subparagraph.content: section 80A; (L.N. 187 of 2016)

subparagraph.name: 6b
subparagraph.content: section 80B; (L.N. 187 of 2016)

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: section 81;

subparagraph.name: viii
subparagraph.content: the collision regulations;

subparagraph.name: ix
subparagraph.content: the use of signals of distress regulations;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a local vessel to which Part 3 applies, whether the vessel is built or arranged in accordance with the plans approved under section 9(1) and the plans amended under section 14, if any; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: without limiting the generality of paragraph (a)(v), if the Director has issued a notice under section 78(2) in respect of the vessel, whether the notice has been complied with.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Issue of certificate of inspection

subsection.content: This section applies to a Class IV vessel that falls within section 15(2)(b) or (ba). (L.N. 70 of 2020)

If, upon completion of a survey of a Class IV vessel, the Director or competent surveyor who carries out the survey is satisfied that the vessel is fit for the service intended and in good condition, he shall issue a certificate of inspection in respect of the vessel.
A certificate of inspection may be subject to such reasonable conditions or restrictions as the Director or competent surveyor (as may be appropriate) may impose.

subsection.leadIn: The Director or competent surveyor (as may be appropriate) may, by giving a written notice to the owner of a Class IV vessel or his agent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: amend or revoke any conditions or restrictions imposed by him; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: impose such new conditions or restrictions as may be reasonable in the circumstances.

subsection.content: The Director or competent surveyor (as may be appropriate) may, for the purposes of subsection (4), direct the owner of a Class IV vessel or his agent to deliver to him the certificate of inspection issued in respect of the vessel.
A certificate of inspection shall be in the specified form.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Director may refuse or temporarily withhold issue of certificate of inspection

subsection.content: This section applies to a survey carried out by the Director on a Class IV vessel that falls within section 15(2)(b) or (ba). (L.N. 70 of 2020)

subsection.leadIn: If, having regard to the findings in a survey of a Class IV vessel, the Director is not satisfied that the vessel is fit for the service intended and in good condition, the Director may either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: refuse to issue a certificate of inspection in respect of the vessel; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: temporarily withhold the issue of the certificate of inspection.

subsection.leadIn: Within 14 days after refusing to issue a certificate of inspection under subsection (2)(a), the Director shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give a written notice of the refusal to the applicant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state in such notice the reasons for the refusal.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Provisions applicable where issue of certificate of inspection is temporarily withheld

subsection.leadIn: Within 14 days after deciding to temporarily withhold the issue of a certificate of inspection in respect of a Class IV vessel under section 20(2)(b), the Director shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give a written notice of the decision to the applicant; and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the reasons for the decision;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the requirements as regards rendering the vessel fit for the issue of the certificate; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the Director sees fit, a requirement that the vessel be re-inspected by him.

subsection.content: If, in a notice given under subsection (1), the Director requires a re-inspection of the Class IV vessel concerned, the owner of the vessel or his agent may, when he considers the requirements stated under subsection (1)(b) have been complied with, apply to the Director for the re-inspection.
An application made under subsection (2) shall be in the specified form and the applicant shall, at the request of the Director, pay the prescribed fee for the re-inspection.

If the Director is satisfied that the requirements stated under subsection (1)(b) have been complied with, he shall issue a certificate of inspection in respect of the Class IV vessel concerned under section 19.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Preparation of declaration of survey under Part 4

subsection.content: This section applies to a survey carried out by a competent surveyor under this Part, except a survey of a Class IV vessel that falls within section 15(2)(b) or (ba). (L.N. 70 of 2020)

A competent surveyor who has carried out a survey of a local vessel shall, if he considers appropriate to do so, submit a declaration of survey to the Director within 14 days after the date of completion of the survey.

subsection.leadIn: A declaration of survey submitted under subsection (2) shall state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether, in the opinion of the competent surveyor, the vessel is fit for the service intended and in good condition;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a local vessel to which Part 3 applies, whether the vessel is built or arranged in accordance with the plans approved under section 9(1) and the plans amended under section 14, if any;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any conditions or restrictions that the operation of the vessel should be made subject to; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other observations, elaborations, qualifications or explanations that are relevant to the issue of the certificate of survey.

subsection.content: A declaration of survey shall be in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: Upon the receipt of a declaration of survey, the Director may—

paragraph.name: a

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the competent surveyor who submitted the declaration; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the owner of the local vessel concerned or his agent,

paragraph.continued: to provide any information that the Director considers relevant to the issue of the certificate of survey; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse to proceed with the application if the information required under paragraph (a) is not provided.

subsection.leadIn: Where a declaration of survey is submitted to the Director in respect of a local vessel, the owner of the vessel or his agent shall, at the request of the Director, pay the prescribed fee for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: considering the declaration of survey; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a certificate of survey is issued, the issue of the certificate.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Director may recognize another document as equivalent to declaration of survey

subsection.content: Notwithstanding section 22, where a survey is carried out by a recognized authority, the Director may recognize another document submitted by the authority as equivalent to a declaration of survey.
Where a document is recognized under subsection (1), references to “declaration of survey” in this Part shall be construed as references to that document.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Issue of certificate of survey

subsection.leadIn: The Director shall issue a certificate of survey in respect of a local vessel if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in a case where the survey is carried out by the Director, he is satisfied that; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in a case where the survey is carried out by a competent surveyor, the matters stated in the declaration of survey submitted under section 22(2) and any information provided pursuant to section 22(5)(a) show that,

subsection.continued: the vessel is fit for the service intended and in good condition.

subsection.content: A certificate of survey may be subject to such reasonable conditions or restrictions as the Director may impose.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may, by giving a written notice to the owner of a local vessel or his agent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: amend or revoke any conditions or restrictions imposed by him; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: impose such new conditions or restrictions as may be reasonable in the circumstances.

subsection.content: The Director may, for the purposes of subsection (3), direct the owner of a local vessel or his agent to deliver to him the certificate of survey issued in respect of the vessel.
A certificate of survey shall be in the specified form.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Director may refuse or temporarily withhold issue of certificate of survey

subsection.leadIn: If, having regard to the findings in a survey of a local vessel carried out by the Director, or to the matters stated in the declaration of survey submitted under section 22(2) and any information provided pursuant to section 22(5)(a), the Director is not satisfied that the vessel is fit for the service intended and in good condition, the Director may either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: refuse to issue a certificate of survey in respect of the vessel; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: temporarily withhold the issue of the certificate of survey.

subsection.leadIn: Within 14 days after refusing to issue a certificate of survey under subsection (1)(a), the Director shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give a written notice of the refusal to the applicant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state in such notice the reasons for the refusal.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Provisions applicable where issue of certificate of survey is temporarily withheld

subsection.leadIn: Within 14 days after deciding to temporarily withhold the issue of a certificate of survey in respect of a local vessel under section 25(1)(b), the Director shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give a written notice of the decision to the applicant; and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the reasons for the decision;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the requirements as regards rendering the vessel fit for the issue of the certificate; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the Director sees fit, a requirement that the vessel be re-inspected by him or the competent surveyor who submitted the declaration of survey in respect of the vessel under section 22(2).

subsection.content: If, in a notice given under subsection (1), the Director requires a re-inspection of the local vessel concerned and such re-inspection is to be carried out by the Director, the owner of the vessel or his agent may, when he considers the requirements stated under subsection (1)(b) have been complied with, apply to the Director for the re-inspection.
An application made under subsection (2) shall be in the specified form and the applicant shall, at the request of the Director, pay the prescribed fee for the re-inspection.

If the Director is satisfied that the requirements stated under subsection (1)(b) have been complied with, he shall issue a certificate of survey in respect of the local vessel concerned under section 24.

If the issue of a certificate of survey in respect of a local vessel is temporarily withheld under section 25(1)(b), any full licence or temporary licence issued under Part 2 of the Certification and Licensing Regulation in respect of the vessel is regarded as having been suspended pending the issue of the certificate of survey.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Validity of certificate of inspection and certificate of survey

subsection.leadIn: A certificate of inspection is valid for the period specified in the certificate, which shall not exceed 12 months from—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of completion of the survey; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if, on the date of completion of the survey, the period of validity of the existing certificate of inspection issued in respect of the local vessel concerned has not expired, the expiry date of such existing certificate, (L.N. 265 of 2006)

subsection.content: Notwithstanding subsection (1), in no circumstances shall the validity of a certificate of inspection exceed 14 months.

subsection.leadIn: A certificate of survey is valid for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 12 months from the date of completion of the survey; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such longer or shorter period as the Director may specify in the certificate.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Cancellation or suspension of certificate of inspection and certificate of survey

subsection.content: The Director may, for any of the reasons prescribed in subsection (2), cancel or suspend a certificate of inspection or certificate of survey.

subsection.leadIn: The reasons prescribed for the purposes of subsection (1) are—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in a case where Part 3 applies, any information provided in the application for approval of any plan leading to the issue of the certificate of inspection or certificate of survey is erroneous, false or misleading in a material particular;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any information provided in the application for the issue of the certificate of inspection or certificate of survey is erroneous, false or misleading in a material particular;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the survey leading to the issue of the certificate of inspection or certificate of survey is founded on information that is erroneous, false or misleading in a material particular;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: in a case where the survey leading to the issue of the certificate of survey is carried out by a competent surveyor, any matters stated in the declaration of survey submitted under section 22(2), or any information provided pursuant to section 22(5)(a), is erroneous, false or misleading in a material particular;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: any material change occurs after the survey leading to the issue of the certificate of inspection or certificate of survey;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: any condition or restriction imposed under section 19(3) or (4)(b) or 24(2) or (3)(b) is contravened;

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: any provision of the Ordinance or any regulation made under it is contravened in relation to the local vessel concerned; or

subparagraph.name: viii
subparagraph.leadIn: the local vessel concerned is no longer—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: fit for the service intended; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: in good condition;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the local vessel concerned is arrested, detained, removed or seized pursuant to any provision of any Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Within 14 days after deciding to cancel or suspend a certificate of inspection or certificate of survey under subsection (1), the Director shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give a written notice of the decision to the owner of the local vessel concerned or his agent; and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the reasons for the decision;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the date on which the cancellation or suspension takes effect; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if applicable, the time within which and the manner in which the owner or agent shall return the certificate to the Director.

subsection.content: Where a certificate of inspection or certificate of survey is suspended under this section, the Director may, upon application made to him or on his own initiative, lift the suspension either conditionally or unconditionally.

A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to return in accordance with a notice given under subsection (3) a certificate of inspection or certificate of survey that is cancelled or suspended commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Certificate of survey to be kept on board the vessel

subsection.leadIn: A certificate of survey in force in respect of a local vessel shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be kept at all times on board the vessel; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be produced for inspection on request by an authorized officer.

subsection.content: If a certificate of survey issued in respect of a local vessel is returned to or deposited with the Director for any reason other than cancellation or suspension, the Director shall issue an official receipt as proof of the return or deposit of the certificate.

subsection.leadIn: An official receipt issued under subsection (2) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be kept at all times on board the vessel to which it relates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be produced for inspection on request by an authorized officer,

subsection.continued: in lieu of the certificate of survey.

subsection.content: If, without reasonable excuse, subsection (1) or (3) is contravened, the owner of the local vessel concerned, his agent and the coxswain each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Display of certificate of inspection or certificate of survey in respect of certain local vessels

subsection.leadIn: The—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: certificate of inspection in force in respect of a Class IV vessel; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: certificate of survey in force in respect of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a Class I vessel;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: a Class II vessel that is—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a pilot boat;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a transportation boat; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: a tug;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a Class IV vessel that is licensed to carry more than 60 passengers,

subsection.continued: shall be displayed at all times in a conspicuous place on the vessel.

subsection.content: If, without reasonable excuse, subsection (1) is contravened, the owner of the local vessel concerned, his agent and the coxswain each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

part.name: P5
part.heading: Construction and Maintenance of Local Vessels, Requirements Relating to Life-saving Appliances, Fire-fighting Apparatus and Fire Protection Measures, etc.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Construction and maintenance of local vessels
section.leadIn: A local vessel shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of good design and construction;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: of adequate stability;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: of sufficient freeboard;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: made of sound materials;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: properly assembled;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: properly maintained;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: regularly inspected;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: fit for the service intended; and

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: in good and serviceable condition.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Provision of life-saving appliances on board the local vessels

subsection.leadIn: All life-saving appliances provided on board a local vessel shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sufficient to ensure the safety of persons on board the vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: properly maintained;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: regularly inspected;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: fit for the function intended; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in good and serviceable condition.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: every local vessel shall comply with the general requirements as regards the provision of life-saving appliances set out in Part 1 of Schedule 3; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: every local vessel belonging to any class, type, category or description of vessel specified in any Table in Part 2 of Schedule 3 shall comply with the specific requirements as regards the provision of life-saving appliances set out in that Table.

subsection.content: If, without reasonable excuse, subsection (1) or (2) is contravened, the owner of the local vessel concerned, his agent and the coxswain each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Fire protection and provision of fire-fighting apparatus on board the local vessels

subsection.leadIn: The measures to be taken to prevent, detect and deal with outbreaks of fire on board a local vessel, including the fire-fighting apparatus provided on board the vessel, shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sufficient to protect the persons and property on board the vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: properly maintained;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: regularly inspected;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: fit for the function intended; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in good and serviceable condition.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: every local vessel shall comply with the general requirements as regards fire protection and the provision of fire-fighting apparatus set out in Part 1 of Schedule 4; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: every local vessel belonging to any class, type, category or description of vessel specified in any Table in Part 2 of Schedule 4 shall comply with the specific requirements as regards fire protection and the provision of fire-fighting apparatus set out in that Table.

subsection.content: If, without reasonable excuse, subsection (1) or (2) is contravened, the owner of the local vessel concerned, his agent and the coxswain each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Survey Records of Safety Equipment for Class II Vessels

section.name: s34
section.heading: Application of Division 2 of Part 5

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), this Division applies to a Class II vessel that is fitted with a propulsion engine and is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: of 24 m or more in length; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that operates within the river trade limits; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a dangerous goods carrier, a gas carrier, a noxious liquid substance carrier, an oil carrier or a special purpose vessel— (L.N. 25 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: of 24 m or more in length; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that operates within the waters of Hong Kong or the river trade limits.

subsection.leadIn: This Division does not apply to a Class II vessel if a cargo ship safety equipment certificate issued by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a recognized authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an organization approved under section 8(1) of the Merchant Shipping (Safety) Ordinance (Cap. 369) for the purposes of issuing such a certificate,

subsection.continued: is in force in respect of the vessel.

def.name: CargoShipSafetyEquipmentCertificate
def.leadIn: In this section, cargo ship safety equipment certificate (貨船設備安全證明書) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a cargo ship safety equipment certificate issued in accordance with Chapter I of the SOLAS Convention; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any certificate that is recognized under that Chapter as the equivalent of or alternative to a certificate specified in paragraph (a).

section.name: s35
section.heading: Offence for operating Class II vessel without survey record of safety equipment

subsection.content: A Class II vessel to which this Division applies shall not be operated unless a survey record of safety equipment is in force in respect of the vessel.

If, without reasonable excuse, subsection (1) is contravened, the owner of the Class II vessel concerned, his agent and the coxswain each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Survey leading to issue of survey record of safety equipment

subsection.content: The Director or a competent surveyor may, upon an application by the owner of a Class II vessel that falls within section 34(1)(a) or his agent, carry out a survey of the vessel in order that a survey record of safety equipment may be issued in respect of the vessel.

The Director may, upon an application by the owner of a Class II vessel that falls within section 34(1)(b) or his agent, carry out a survey of the vessel in order that a survey record of safety equipment may be issued in respect of the vessel.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Matters to be surveyed under Division 2 of Part 5
section.content: A survey record of safety equipment shall only be issued in respect of a Class II vessel if sections 31, 32(1) and (2), 33(1) and (2) and 81, in so far as they are applicable, have been complied with in relation to the vessel.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Preparation of declaration of survey under Division 2 of Part 5

subsection.content: A competent surveyor who has carried out a survey under section 36(1) shall, if he considers appropriate to do so, submit a declaration of survey to the Director within 14 days after the date of completion of the survey.

subsection.leadIn: A declaration of survey submitted under subsection (1) shall state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether, in the opinion of the competent surveyor, sections 31, 32(1) and (2), 33(1) and (2) and 81, in so far as they are applicable, have been complied with in relation to the Class II vessel concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a Class II vessel to which Part 3 applies, whether the vessel is built or arranged in accordance with the plans approved under section 9(2) and the plans amended under section 14, if any; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the matters stated in section 58.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Issue of survey record of safety equipment
section.leadIn: The Director shall issue a survey record of safety equipment in respect of a Class II vessel to which this Division applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in a case where the survey is carried out by the Director, he is satisfied that; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in a case where the survey is carried out by a competent surveyor, the matters stated in the declaration of survey submitted under section 38(1) and any information provided pursuant to section 60(a) show that,

section.continued: sections 31, 32(1) and (2), 33(1) and (2) and 81, in so far as they are applicable, have been complied with in relation to the vessel.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Validity of survey record of safety equipment
section.leadIn: A survey record of safety equipment is valid for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 12 months from the date of completion of the survey; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such longer or shorter period as the Director may specify in the record.

part.name: P6
part.heading: HKLL Certificates and FA Certificates for Class II Vessels

section.name: s41
section.heading: Application of Part 6

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), this Part applies to a Class II vessel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which belongs to a type, category or description of vessel specified in Part 1 of Schedule 5; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in respect of which it is specified in that Part that a HKLL certificate or FA certificate is required.

subsection.leadIn: This Part does not apply to a Class II vessel if an international load line certificate issued by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a recognized authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an organization approved under section 8(1) of the Merchant Shipping (Safety) Ordinance (Cap. 369) for the purposes of issuing such a certificate,

subsection.continued: in accordance with the Load Lines Convention is in force in respect of the vessel.

section.name: s42
section.heading: Offence for operating Class II vessel without HKLL certificate or FA certificate

subsection.content: A Class II vessel to which this Part applies shall not be operated unless a HKLL certificate or FA certificate is in force in respect of the vessel.

If, without reasonable excuse, subsection (1) is contravened, the owner of the Class II vessel concerned, his agent and the coxswain each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Survey leading to issue of HKLL certificate or FA certificate
section.content: The Director or a competent surveyor may, upon an application by the owner of a Class II vessel to which this Part applies or his agent, carry out a survey of the vessel in order that a HKLL certificate or FA certificate may be issued in respect of the vessel.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Matters to be surveyed under Part 6
section.leadIn: A HKLL certificate or FA certificate shall only be issued in respect of a Class II vessel if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in a case where the vessel has to be issued with a HKLL certificate for the first time—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the conditions of assignment are complied with; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: its load lines are calculated and marked in accordance with the Load Lines Convention;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in a case where the vessel has to be issued with a FA certificate for the first time—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: its freeboard is calculated in accordance with Part 2 of Schedule 5; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: its freeboard marks are marked in accordance with Part 3 of Schedule 5;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in a case where the vessel has been issued with a HKLL certificate or FA certificate (whether or not such certificate has expired)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the conditions of assignment are complied with;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: no alteration that would affect the accuracy of the data based on which freeboard was assigned to the vessel has been made to the vessel; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the load line marks or freeboard marks are correctly and permanently marked on the vessel.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Preparation of declaration of survey under Part 6

subsection.content: A competent surveyor who has carried out a survey under section 43 shall, if he considers appropriate to do so, submit a declaration of survey to the Director within 14 days after the date of completion of the survey.

subsection.leadIn: A declaration of survey submitted under subsection (1) shall state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether, in the opinion of the competent surveyor, section 44, in so far as it is applicable, has been complied with in relation to the Class II vessel concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a Class II vessel to which Part 3 applies, whether the vessel is built or arranged in accordance with the plans approved under section 9(3) and the plans amended under section 14, if any; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the matters stated in section 58.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Issue of HKLL certificate or FA certificate
section.leadIn: The Director shall issue a Hong Kong load line certificate or freeboard assignment certificate in respect of a Class II vessel to which this Part applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in a case where the survey is carried out by the Director, he is satisfied that; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in a case where the survey is carried out by a competent surveyor, the matters stated in the declaration of survey submitted under section 45(1) and any information provided pursuant to section 60(a) show that,

section.continued: section 44, in so far as it is applicable, has been complied with in relation to the vessel.

section.name: s47
section.heading: Validity of HKLL certificate or FA certificate
section.leadIn: A HKLL certificate or FA certificate is valid for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 12 months from the date of completion of the survey; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such longer or shorter period as the Director may specify in the certificate.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Alteration of load line marks or freeboard marks prohibited
section.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, obliterates or alters any load line marks or freeboard marks marked on a Class II vessel commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

part.name: P7
part.heading: Declarations of Fitness for Carriage of Dangerous Goods

section.name: s49
section.heading: Application of Part 7

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), this Part applies to a local vessel that is used or to be used for carrying any dangerous goods.

subsection.leadIn: This Part does not apply to the carrying in a local vessel of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any Class 1 dangerous goods (as defined by section 2 of the Dangerous Goods (Shipping) Regulation 2012 (Cap. 295 sub. leg. F)) that are—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any liquefied petroleum gas that is—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: in a cylinder that has a water capacity of less than 130 litres; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: in a combination of cylinders that have a combined water capacity of less than 130 litres; and
conveyed for and incidental to the production of entertainment special effects (as defined by section 2 of the Entertainment Special Effects Ordinance (Cap. 560)); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other dangerous goods, if the conveyance of the dangerous goods is exempt from the operation of section 6 of the Dangerous Goods Ordinance (Cap. 295) under Part 3 of the Dangerous Goods (Application and Exemption) Regulation 2012 (Cap. 295 sub. leg. E). (29 of 2021 s. 64)

subsection.leadIn: This Part does not apply to a local vessel if a document of compliance issued by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a recognized authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an organization approved under section 8(1) of the Merchant Shipping (Safety) Ordinance (Cap. 369) for the purposes of issuing such a document,

subsection.continued: is in force in respect of the vessel.

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—
subsection.def: dangerous goods (危險品) has the meaning given by section 3 of the Dangerous Goods (Shipping) Regulation 2012 (Cap. 295 sub. leg. F); (29 of 2021 s. 64)
document of compliance (符合證明) means a document evidencing compliance with the special requirements for ships carrying dangerous goods issued in accordance with Chapter II-2 of the SOLAS Convention.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Offence for operating local vessel without declaration of fitness

subsection.content: A local vessel to which this Part applies shall not be operated unless a declaration of fitness is in force in respect of the vessel.

If, without reasonable excuse, subsection (1) is contravened, the owner of the local vessel concerned, his agent and the coxswain each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Survey leading to issue of declaration of fitness
section.content: The Director or a competent surveyor may, upon an application by the owner of a local vessel to which this Part applies or his agent, carry out a survey of the vessel in order that a declaration of fitness may be issued in respect of the vessel.

section.name: s52
section.heading: Matters to be surveyed under Part 7
section.content: A declaration of fitness for the purposes of carrying any type of dangerous goods on a local vessel shall only be issued in respect of the vessel if, having regard to the structures, equipments, signals, flags and arrangements of the vessel, the Director is satisfied that the vessel is suitable and fit to carry that type of dangerous goods.

section.name: s53
section.heading: Preparation of declaration of survey under Part 7

subsection.content: A competent surveyor who has carried out a survey under section 51 shall, if he considers appropriate to do so, submit a declaration of survey to the Director within 14 days after the date of completion of the survey.

subsection.leadIn: A declaration of survey submitted under subsection (1) shall state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether, in the opinion of the competent surveyor, the local vessel concerned is suitable and fit to carry the type of dangerous goods concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a local vessel to which Part 3 applies, whether the vessel is built or arranged in accordance with the plans approved under section 9(4) and the plans amended under section 14, if any; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the matters stated in section 58.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Issue of declaration of fitness
section.leadIn: The Director shall issue a declaration of fitness for the carriage of dangerous goods in respect of a local vessel to which this Part applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in a case where the survey is carried out by the Director, he is satisfied that; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in a case where the survey is carried out by a competent surveyor, the matters stated in the declaration of survey submitted under section 53(1) and any information provided pursuant to section 60(a) show that,

section.continued: the vessel is suitable and fit to carry the type of dangerous goods concerned.

section.name: s55
section.heading: Validity of declaration of fitness
section.leadIn: A declaration of fitness is valid for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 12 months from the date of completion of the survey; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such longer or shorter period as the Director may specify in the declaration.

part.name: P8
part.heading: General Provisions that Apply to Local Vessels to which Parts 5, 6 and 7 Apply

section.name: s56
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 8
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: declaration of survey (檢驗聲明) means a declaration of survey submitted under section 38(1), 45(1) or 53(1), as may be appropriate;

def.name: StatutoryInstrument

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a survey record of safety equipment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a HKLL certificate;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a FA certificate; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a declaration of fitness,

def.continued: as may be appropriate depending on the provision under which a survey is applied for;

section.def: survey (檢驗) means a survey carried out under section 36(1) or (2), 43 or 51, as may be appropriate.

section.name: s57
section.heading: Application for survey

subsection.leadIn: An application to the Director for survey of a local vessel shall be in the specified form and the applicant shall, at the request of the Director, pay the prescribed fee for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the survey; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a statutory instrument is issued, the issue of the instrument.

subsection.content: Where a survey of a local vessel is to be carried out by a competent surveyor, the owner of the vessel or his agent shall, as soon as practicable after engaging the surveyor and in any event before the survey is carried out, notify the Director of the engagement in the specified form.

section.name: s58
section.heading: Matters to be stated in declaration of survey
section.leadIn: A declaration of survey shall state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any conditions or restrictions that the operation of the local vessel concerned should be made subject to; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other observations, elaborations, qualifications or explanations that are relevant to the issue of the statutory instrument.

section.name: s59
section.heading: Specified form and prescribed fee

subsection.content: A declaration of survey shall be in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: Where a declaration of survey is submitted to the Director in respect of a local vessel, the owner of the vessel or his agent shall, at the request of the Director, pay the prescribed fee for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: considering the declaration of survey; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a statutory instrument is issued, the issue of the instrument.

section.name: s60
section.heading: Provision of further information
section.leadIn: Upon the receipt of a declaration of survey, the Director may—

paragraph.name: a

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the competent surveyor who submitted the declaration; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the owner of the local vessel concerned or his agent,

paragraph.continued: to provide any information that the Director considers relevant to the issue of the statutory instrument; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse to proceed with the application if the information required under paragraph (a) is not provided.

section.name: s61
section.heading: Director may recognize another document as equivalent to declaration of survey

subsection.content: Where a survey is carried out by a recognized authority, the Director may recognize another document submitted by the authority as equivalent to a declaration of survey.
Where a document is recognized under subsection (1), references to “declaration of survey” in this Part and Part 5, 6 or 7 (as may be appropriate) shall be construed as references to that document.

section.name: s62
section.heading: Conditions and restrictions attached to statutory instrument

subsection.content: A statutory instrument may be subject to such reasonable conditions or restrictions as the Director may impose.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may, by giving a written notice to the owner of a local vessel or his agent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: amend or revoke any conditions or restrictions imposed by him; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: impose such new conditions or restrictions as may be reasonable in the circumstances.

subsection.content: The Director may, for the purposes of subsection (2), direct the owner of a local vessel or his agent to deliver to him the statutory instrument issued in respect of the vessel.

section.name: s63
section.heading: Statutory instrument to be in specified form
section.content: A statutory instrument shall be in the specified form.

section.name: s64
section.heading: Director may refuse or temporarily withhold issue of statutory instrument

subsection.leadIn: If, having regard to the findings in a survey of a local vessel carried out by the Director, or to the matters stated in a declaration of survey and any information provided pursuant to section 60(a), the Director is not satisfied that a statutory instrument should be issued in respect of the vessel, the Director may either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: refuse to issue the instrument; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: temporarily withhold the issue of the instrument.

subsection.leadIn: Within 14 days after refusing to issue a statutory instrument under subsection (1)(a), the Director shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give a written notice of the refusal to the applicant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state in such notice the reasons for the refusal.

section.name: s65
section.heading: Provisions applicable where issue of statutory instrument is temporarily withheld
