subsection.leadIn: Within 14 days after deciding to temporarily withhold the issue of a statutory instrument in respect of a local vessel under section 64(1)(b), the Director shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give a written notice of the decision to the applicant; and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the reasons for the decision;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the requirements as regards rendering the vessel fit for the issue of the instrument; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the Director sees fit, a requirement that the vessel be re-inspected by him or the competent surveyor who submitted the declaration of survey in respect of the vessel.

subsection.content: If, in a notice given under subsection (1), the Director requires for a re-inspection of the local vessel concerned and such re-inspection is to be carried out by the Director, the owner of the vessel or his agent may, when he considers the requirements stated under subsection (1)(b) have been complied with, apply to the Director for the re-inspection.
An application made under subsection (2) shall be in the specified form and the applicant shall, at the request of the Director, pay the prescribed fee for the re-inspection.
If the Director is satisfied that the requirements stated under subsection (1)(b) have been complied with, he shall issue a statutory instrument in respect of the local vessel concerned.
For the avoidance of doubt, sections 62 and 63 applies to a statutory instrument issued under subsection (4).

section.name: s66
section.heading: Cancellation or suspension of statutory instrument

subsection.content: The Director may, for any of the reasons prescribed in subsection (2), cancel or suspend a statutory instrument.

subsection.leadIn: The reasons prescribed for the purposes of subsection (1) are—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in a case where Part 3 applies, any information provided in the application for approval of any plan leading to the issue of the statutory instrument is erroneous, false or misleading in a material particular;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any information provided in the application for the issue of the statutory instrument is erroneous, false or misleading in a material particular;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the survey leading to the issue of the statutory instrument is founded on information that is erroneous, false or misleading in a material particular;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: in a case where the survey leading to the issue of a statutory instrument is carried out by a competent surveyor, any matters stated in the declaration of survey or any information provided pursuant to section 60(a), is erroneous, false or misleading in a material particular;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: any material change occurs after the survey leading to the issue of the statutory instrument;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: any condition or restriction imposed under section 62(1) or (2)(b) is contravened;

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: any provision of the Ordinance or any regulation made under it is contravened in relation to the local vessel concerned; or

subparagraph.name: viii
subparagraph.leadIn: the local vessel concerned is no longer—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: fit for the service intended; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: in good condition;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the local vessel concerned is arrested, detained, removed or seized pursuant to any provision of any Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Within 14 days after deciding to cancel or suspend a statutory instrument under subsection (1), the Director shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give a written notice of the decision to the owner of the vessel or his agent; and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the reasons for the decision;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the date on which the cancellation or suspension takes effect; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if applicable, the time within which and the manner in which the owner or agent shall return the statutory instrument to the Director.

subsection.content: Where a statutory instrument is suspended under this section, the Director may, upon application made to him or on his own initiative, lift the suspension either conditionally or unconditionally.

A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to return in accordance with a notice given under subsection (3) a statutory instrument that is cancelled or suspended commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s67
section.heading: Statutory instrument to be kept on board the vessel

subsection.leadIn: A statutory instrument in force in respect of a local vessel shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be kept at all times on board the vessel; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be produced for inspection on request by an authorized officer.

subsection.content: If a statutory instrument issued in respect of a local vessel is returned to or deposited with the Director for any reason other than cancellation or suspension, the Director shall issue an official receipt as proof of the return or deposit of the statutory instrument.

subsection.leadIn: An official receipt issued under subsection (2) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be kept at all times on board the vessel to which it relates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be produced for inspection on request by an authorized officer,

subsection.continued: in lieu of the statutory instrument.

subsection.content: If, without reasonable excuse, subsection (1) or (3) is contravened, the owner of the local vessel concerned, his agent and the coxswain each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

part.name: P9
part.heading: Requirements Relating to Carriage of Passengers

def.name: MaterialConsiderations
def.heading: Meaning of material considerations
def.leadIn: In sections 69(3), 70(3) and 72(1), material considerations (考慮因素), in relation to a local vessel, means, in so far as they apply to the vessel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its class, type and category;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: its mode of operation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: its intended service;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: its stability;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the clear space available;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the number of seats available;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the space occupied by cargo or baggage; and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: any other matter of public interest.

section.name: s69
section.heading: Carriage of passengers in local vessels other than certain Class IV vessels

subsection.content: This section applies to any local vessel other than a Class IV vessel in respect of which a certificate of inspection is required.

subsection.leadIn: The Director shall determine the number of passengers that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a local vessel may carry; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: local vessels belonging to a class, type, category or description of vessel may carry.

subsection.leadIn: When making a determination under subsection (2), the Director shall, in addition to any other matter that he considers relevant, have regard to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the material considerations defined in section 68; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in a case where a certificate of survey is issued in respect of the local vessel concerned and the survey concerned is carried out by a competent surveyor, any information regarding the carriage of passengers contained in the declaration of survey submitted under section 22(2).

subsection.leadIn: The number of passengers that a local vessel may carry as determined under subsection (2) shall be specified in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its operating licence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a certificate of survey is issued in respect of the vessel, the certificate.

section.name: s70
section.heading: Carriage of passengers in Class IV vessels in respect of which certificates of inspection are required

subsection.content: This section applies to a Class IV vessel in respect of which a certificate of inspection is required.

subsection.leadIn: The number of passengers that a Class IV vessel to which this section applies may carry shall be determined by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the survey leading to the issue of the certificate of inspection in respect of the vessel is carried out by the Director, the Director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the survey is carried out by a competent surveyor, the competent surveyor.

subsection.content: When making a determination under subsection (2), the Director or competent surveyor shall, in addition to any other matter that he considers relevant, have regard to the material considerations defined in section 68.

subsection.leadIn: The number of passengers that a Class IV vessel to which this section applies may carry as determined under subsection (2) shall be specified in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its operating licence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the certificate of inspection issued in respect of the vessel.

section.name: s71
section.heading: Amendment to number of passengers shown in operating licence

subsection.content: This section applies when the number of passengers that a local vessel may carry as shown in its existing operating licence is different from the number of passengers specified in the certificate of inspection or certificate of survey issued in respect of the vessel.

The owner of the local vessel concerned or his agent shall, within 7 days after the date of issue of the certificate of inspection or certificate of survey, return the existing operating licence to the Director, and the Director shall, subject to subsection (3), issue a new operating licence in respect of the vessel in which the same number of passengers as that specified in the certificate shall be shown.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the number of passengers as shown in the existing operating licence of the local vessel concerned is less than the number of passengers specified in its certificate of inspection or certificate of survey, the issue of a new operating licence is subject to payment of the prescribed fee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of passengers as shown in the existing operating licence of the local vessel concerned is more than the number of passengers specified in its certificate of inspection or certificate of survey, the issue of a new operating licence shall be free of charge.

subsection.content: A new operating licence issued under subsection (2) is valid for the remainder of the period of validity of the existing operating licence.

section.name: s72
section.heading: Director may reduce number of passengers that local vessel may carry

subsection.leadIn: If, having regard to the material considerations defined in section 68 and any special circumstances of the case, the Director considers a local vessel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: should no longer carry the number of passengers that it is allowed to carry; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: should not be allowed to carry the number of passengers that local vessels of the same class, type, category or description of vessel may carry,

subsection.continued: the Director may, by a written notice given to the owner of the vessel or his agent, direct that the vessel shall only carry such lesser number of passengers as he may determine.

subsection.leadIn: The Director shall state in a notice given under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reasons for making the direction; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the time within which and the manner in which the owner of the local vessel concerned or his agent shall return to the Director—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the operating licence; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the certificate of inspection or certificate of survey, if any,

paragraph.continued: issued in respect of the vessel.

subsection.content: Where an operating licence, certificate of inspection or certificate of survey is returned to the Director pursuant to subsection (2), the Director shall, upon payment of the prescribed fee, issue a new operating licence, certificate of inspection or certificate of survey, as the case may be, in respect of the local vessel concerned in which the lesser number of passengers shall be specified.

A new operating licence, certificate of inspection or certificate of survey issued under subsection (3) is valid for the remainder of the period of validity of the existing operating licence, certificate of inspection or certificate of survey.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a notice given under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s73
section.heading: Spaces below main deck not to be used as passenger spaces

subsection.content: Unless the Director directs otherwise, no space below the main deck of a local vessel shall be used as a passenger space.

If, without reasonable excuse, subsection (1) is contravened, the owner of the local vessel concerned, his agent and the coxswain each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s74
section.heading: Additional requirement relating to passenger spaces in Class I vessels

subsection.content: Any space in a Class I vessel that is a Category A vessel at which the noise level exceeds 85 dB(A) when measured at the maximum operating speed of the propulsion engine shall not be used as a passenger space.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: maximum operating speed (最高運作速度) means the greatest speed that the propulsion shafting of a local vessel can achieve;

def.name: NoiseLevel
def.leadIn: noise level (噪音聲級) means “A” weighted sound pressure level in decibels dB(A) as defined and tabulated in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the British Standards specification number BS 5969:1981; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other equivalent standard.

section.name: s75
section.heading: Application of Part 10
section.leadIn: This Part applies to a local vessel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in respect of which one or more of the following instruments is in force—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a certificate of inspection;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a certificate of survey;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a survey record of safety equipment;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a HKLL certificate;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: a FA certificate;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: a declaration of fitness; and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to an extent that will render the particulars stated in any certificate, record or declaration referred to in paragraph (a) inaccurate; but

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: not to the extent that will render the vessel a new vessel.

section.name: s76
section.heading: Alteration of local vessels other than certain Class IV vessels

subsection.content: Subject to section 77(5), this section applies to a local vessel other than a Class IV vessel in respect of which a certificate of inspection is issued by a competent surveyor.
The owner of a local vessel to which this section applies or his agent shall apply for a written permission of the Director before making any alteration to the vessel.

subsection.leadIn: An application made under subsection (2) shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by information that the applicant considers necessary to enable the Director to determine the application.

subsection.leadIn: Upon considering an application made under subsection (2), the Director may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: either unconditionally or subject to any reasonable conditions or restrictions, give the applicant a written permission to make the alteration concerned; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: temporarily withhold the giving of the written permission and state, by a written notice to the applicant, the requirements to be complied with before a permission may be given.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of subsection (4)(b), the Director may require—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the approval of plans relating to the alteration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the survey of the local vessel concerned after the alteration;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the re-issue of any certificate, record or declaration referred to in section 75(a);

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: considering the plans; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: if the plans are approved, the approval of the plans;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the prescribed fee for surveying the local vessel concerned; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the prescribed fee for re-issuing any certificate, record or declaration referred to in section 75(a).

subsection.content: If the Director is satisfied that the requirements stated in a notice given under subsection (4)(b) have been complied with, he may either unconditionally or subject to any reasonable conditions or restrictions, give the applicant a written permission to make the alteration concerned.

section.name: s77
section.heading: Alteration of Class IV vessels that are issued with certificates of inspection

subsection.content: This section applies to a Class IV vessel in respect of which a certificate of inspection is issued by a competent surveyor.

The owner of a Class IV vessel to which this section applies or his agent shall apply for a written permission of the competent surveyor who issued the certificate of inspection in respect of the vessel before making any alteration to the vessel.

subsection.leadIn: Upon considering an application made under subsection (2), a competent surveyor may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: either unconditionally or subject to any reasonable conditions or restrictions, give the applicant a written permission to make the alteration concerned; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: temporarily withhold the giving of the written permission and state, by a written notice to the applicant, the requirements to be complied with before a permission may be given.

subsection.content: If a competent surveyor is satisfied that the requirements stated in a notice given under subsection (3)(b) have been complied with, he may either unconditionally or subject to any reasonable conditions or restrictions, give the applicant a written permission to make the alteration concerned.

If for any reason the competent surveyor who issued the certificate of inspection in respect of the Class IV vessel concerned is unable to give a written permission under this section, the owner of the vessel or his agent may refer the matter to the Director and section 76 applies to the vessel accordingly.

section.name: s78
section.heading: Consequences for alteration without permission

subsection.content: If a written permission given under section 76(4)(a) or (6) or 77(3)(a) or (4) is required under this Part for the alteration of a local vessel but the alteration is made, without reasonable excuse, in the absence of such permission, the person who makes or causes the making of the alteration commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

If a local vessel has been altered as described in subsection (1), the Director may, by a written notice given to the owner of the vessel or his agent, require that the vessel be restored to the condition the vessel was in immediately before the alteration.

The Director may suspend any certificate, record or declaration referred to in section 75(a) until he is satisfied that a requirement under subsection (2) has been complied with in relation to the local vessel concerned.

part.name: P11
part.heading: Specific Requirements Relating to Plying Limits, Use of Fuel, Radars, Engines and Other Equipment

section.name: s78A
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 11
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: VHF (甚高頻) means very high frequency.

section.name: s79
section.heading: Class II vessels not permitted to ply beyond waters of Hong Kong

subsection.leadIn: A Class II vessel of 24 m or more in length that—

paragraph.name: a

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a flat-top work barge;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a floating workshop;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a pilot boat;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a transportation boat; or

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: a work boat,

paragraph.continued: fitted with any propulsion engine; or

paragraph.name: b

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a crane barge;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a flat-top work barge;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a floating workshop;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a landing platform;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: a landing pontoon;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: a stationary vessel; or

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: a work boat,

paragraph.continued: not fitted with any propulsion engine,

subsection.continued: shall not ply beyond the waters of Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: A Class II vessel of less than 24 m in length that—

paragraph.name: a

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a dangerous goods carrier;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a dredger;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a dry cargo vessel;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: an edible oil carrier;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: a flat-top work barge;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: a floating workshop;

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: a noxious liquid substance carrier;

subparagraph.name: viii
subparagraph.content: an oil carrier;

subparagraph.name: ix
subparagraph.content: a pilot boat;

subparagraph.name: x
subparagraph.content: a transportation boat;

subparagraph.name: xi
subparagraph.content: a transportation sampan;

subparagraph.name: xii
subparagraph.content: a water boat; or

subparagraph.name: xiii
subparagraph.content: a work boat,

paragraph.continued: fitted with any propulsion engine; or

paragraph.name: b

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a crane barge;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a dangerous goods carrier;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a dumb lighter;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: an edible oil carrier;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: a flat-top work barge;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: a floating workshop;

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: a hopper barge;

subparagraph.name: viii
subparagraph.content: a landing platform;

subparagraph.name: ix
subparagraph.content: a landing pontoon;

subparagraph.name: x
subparagraph.content: a noxious liquid substance carrier;

subparagraph.name: xi
subparagraph.content: an oil carrier;

subparagraph.name: xii
subparagraph.content: a stationary vessel;

subparagraph.name: xiii
subparagraph.content: a transportation sampan; or

subparagraph.name: xiv
subparagraph.content: a work boat,

paragraph.continued: not fitted with any propulsion engine,

subsection.continued: shall not ply beyond the waters of Hong Kong.

subsection.content: If, without reasonable excuse, subsection (1) or (2) is contravened, the owner of the Class II vessel concerned, his agent and the coxswain each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s80
section.heading: Radar

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a Class I vessel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is a ferry vessel or launch;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that operates a franchised service or a licensed service as defined in the Ferry Services Ordinance (Cap. 104); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that plies outside the boundaries of the Victoria port.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: This section also applies to a Class I vessel that is licensed to carry more than 100 passengers except—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a floating restaurant;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a stationary vessel;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a vessel the operating licence of which restricts the vessel to plying within a typhoon shelter; or

subparagraph.content: that is in use on or is reserved for a franchised service or a licensed service as defined in the Ferry Services Ordinance (Cap. 104);
that is subject to the maximum permitted speed specified in Schedule 2 to the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (General) Regulation (Cap. 548 sub. leg. F); and
the operating licence of which restricts the vessel to plying within the boundaries of the Victoria port. (L.N. 187 of 2016)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: This section also applies to a Class IV vessel that is licensed to carry more than 100 passengers. (L.N. 70 of 2020)

A Class I vessel or Class IV vessel to which this section applies shall be fitted with radar equipment that is capable of determining whether any risk of collision exists, including equipment that can, by long-range scanning, give early warning of any risk of collision. (L.N. 70 of 2020)

If, without reasonable excuse, subsection (2) is contravened, the owner of the Class I vessel or Class IV vessel concerned, his agent and the coxswain each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3. (L.N. 70 of 2020)

section.name: s80A
section.heading: Automatic identification system

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a Class I vessel that is licensed to carry more than 100 passengers except—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a floating restaurant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a stationary vessel; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a vessel the operating licence of which restricts the vessel to plying within a typhoon shelter.

subsection.leadIn: This section also applies to a Class II vessel that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a dangerous goods carrier;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a gas carrier; (L.N. 25 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a noxious liquid substance carrier;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an oil carrier; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a vessel of 300 gross tonnage or above fitted with a propulsion engine.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: This section also applies to a Class IV vessel that is licensed to carry more than 100 passengers. (L.N. 70 of 2020)
A vessel must be fitted with an automatic identification system.

subsection.leadIn: The following information must be stored and maintained in the automatic identification system—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Maritime Mobile Service Identity number of the vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of the vessel as specified in its certificate of ownership; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the identifier number of the vessel.

subsection.content: If subsection (3) or (4) is contravened, each person specified in subsection (6) commits an offence if the person has no reasonable excuse for the contravention.

subsection.leadIn: The persons are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the owner of the vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the owner’s agent; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the coxswain of the vessel.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (5) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: AutomaticIdentificationSystem
def.leadIn: automatic identification system (自動識別系統) means a system that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: meets the relevant requirements in Annex 2 to the ITU recommendation; and

subparagraph.content: providing the specified information automatically to appropriately equipped shore stations, other vessels and aircraft;
receiving the specified information automatically from other vessels fitted with the system;
monitoring and tracking other vessels fitted with the system; and
exchanging data with shore-based facilities;

subsection.def: ITU recommendation (《國際電信聯盟建議書》) means the Recommendation ITU-R M.1371 “Technical characteristics for an automatic identification system using time division multiple access in the VHF maritime mobile frequency band” approved by the International Telecommunication Union, as amended from time to time;

Maritime Mobile Service Identity number (MMSI編號), in relation to a vessel, means the maritime mobile service identity number specified in the licence of the vessel granted by the Communications Authority under the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106), for the use of the automatic identification system fitted on the vessel;
specified information (指明資料), in relation to a vessel, includes the identity, type, position, course, speed, navigational status and other safety related information of the vessel.

section.name: s80B
section.heading: Radiotelephone equipment

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a Class I vessel that is licensed to carry more than 12 passengers except—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a floating restaurant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a stationary vessel;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a vessel to which Part 9 of the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (General) Regulation (Cap. 548 sub. leg. F) applies; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a vessel the operating licence of which restricts the vessel to plying within a typhoon shelter.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: This section also applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Class IV vessel that is licensed to carry 13 to 60 passengers and is let for hire or reward; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a Class IV vessel that is licensed to carry more than 60 passengers. (L.N. 70 of 2020)

subsection.content: A vessel must have on board radiotelephone equipment for VHF radiotelephone communication that is capable of operation on specified VHF channels.
The radiotelephone equipment must be available for operation from the navigational bridge of a vessel, or if there is no navigational bridge on the vessel, from its steering position.
If subsection (2) or (3) is contravened, each person specified in subsection (5) commits an offence if the person has no reasonable excuse for the contravention.

subsection.leadIn: The persons are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the owner of the vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the owner’s agent; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the coxswain of the vessel.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (4) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: Radio Regulations (《無線電規則》) means the Radio Regulations complementing the Constitution and Convention of the International Telecommunication Union as in force from time to time; (L.N. 127 of 2024)

specified VHF channel (指明甚高頻頻道), in relation to VHF radiotelephone communication, means a radiotelephone channel in the VHF band provided for in the Radio Regulations and specified in column 1 of the First Schedule to the Shipping and Port Control Regulations (Cap. 313 sub. leg. A);
steering position (操舵位置) means the position from which the vessel is steered.

section.name: s81
section.heading: Restriction on fitting of certain engines and equipment

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), a Class I vessel, Class II vessel or Class III vessel shall not be fitted with an engine that uses petroleum fuel with a flash point of less than 60°C (closed cup test). (L.N. 187 of 2016)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: A local vessel must not be fitted with an engine or equipment that uses gaseous or liquid fuel (other than petroleum fuel) with a flash point of less than 60ºC (closed cup test), unless the fitting of such engine or equipment is approved by the Director. (27 of 2024 s. 31)
Subsection (1) does not apply to a local vessel specified in Schedule 6. (L.N. 25 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: uses or operates;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: permits to be used or operated; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is in charge of,

subsection.continued: a local vessel in respect of which subsection (1) or (1A) is contravened commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s81A
section.heading: Requirements relating to vessels fitted with engines or equipment that use low-flashpoint fuel

subsection.leadIn: The owner, the owner’s agent and the coxswain of a gas carrier fitted with an engine or equipment that uses low-flashpoint fuel must ensure that the liquefied gases in bulk on board are conveyed and handled in a manner such that the following risks are minimized—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: risk to the safety of the gas carrier;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: risk to the health and safety of any person on board;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: risk of damage to the environment.

subsection.leadIn: The owner, the owner’s agent and the coxswain of a vessel (other than a gas carrier) fitted with an engine or equipment that uses low-flashpoint fuel must ensure that low-flashpoint fuel is used and handled in a manner such that the following risks are minimized—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: risk to the safety of the vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: risk to the health and safety of any person on board;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: risk of damage to the environment.

subsection.content: If subsection (1) or (2) is contravened in respect of a vessel, the owner, the owner’s agent and the coxswain of the vessel each commit an offence and are liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.
It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (3) to prove that the person had a reasonable excuse for contravening subsection (1) or (2) (as the case requires).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: low-flashpoint fuel (低閃點燃料) means gaseous or liquid fuel (other than petroleum fuel) with a flash point of less than 60ºC (closed cup test).

section.name: s82
section.heading: Compliance with requirements of Merchant Shipping (Prevention of Oil Pollution) Regulations
section.content: A local vessel belonging to any class, type, category or description of vessel specified in Schedule 7 shall comply with the requirements of the Merchant Shipping (Prevention of Oil Pollution) Regulations (Cap. 413 sub. leg. A).

section.name: s83
section.heading: Director may permit alternative fitting, etc.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies where this Regulation requires—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a local vessel to be fitted with, or to carry on board, any fitting, material, appliance or apparatus of a particular description or type; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any particular provision be made for a local vessel.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may permit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a local vessel to be fitted with, or to carry on board, any other fitting, material, appliance or apparatus; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other provision be made for a local vessel,

subsection.continued: as an alternative to that required by this Regulation if the Director is satisfied by trial or otherwise that such fitting, material, appliance, apparatus or provision is at least as effective as that required under this Regulation.

section.name: s84
section.heading: Director may issue instructions or directions by way of Marine Department Notices
section.content: For the purposes of providing practical guidance with respect to specifications, standards or requirements relating to local vessels, the Director may from time to time issue instructions or directions by way of a Marine Department Notice.

section.name: s85
section.heading: Duplicate certificate of survey, etc.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any of the following instruments is in force in respect of a local vessel—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a certificate of inspection;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a certificate of survey;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a survey record of safety equipment;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a HKLL certificate;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: a FA certificate;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: a declaration of fitness; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such instrument is, for any reason, destructed, defaced or lost.

subsection.content: The Director may, upon an application by the owner of a local vessel or his agent and upon being satisfied of the destruction, defacement or loss of an instrument referred to in subsection (1), issue to the owner or his agent a duplicate of the instrument.
A duplicate issued under subsection (2) in respect of an instrument referred to in subsection (1) shall be regarded for the purposes of this Regulation as the instrument.

subsection.leadIn: An application made under subsection (2) shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: Every duplicate issued under subsection (2) shall be clearly endorsed in a conspicuous place with the English word “DUPLICATE” and the Chinese characters “複本”.

subsection.leadIn: A duplicate issued under subsection (2) shall supersede the original concerned which shall cease to have effect and shall be returned to the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the original is not totally destructed or is only defaced, on the making of an application under subsection (2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the original is lost, as soon as it is found.

subsection.content: Where, without reasonable excuse, the original of an instrument referred to in subsection (1) is not returned as required by subsection (6), the owner of the local vessel concerned and his agent each commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s86
section.heading: Appeals against decisions of Director

subsection.leadIn: A person who is aggrieved by a decision made by the Director in respect of the person under any of the following provisions may appeal to the Administrative Appeals Board—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 10(1)(c) and (d) (refusing to approve or temporarily withholding the approval of any plan);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 19(3) (imposing conditions or restrictions on a certificate of inspection);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 19(4) (amending or revoking conditions or restrictions imposed on a certificate of inspection, or imposing new conditions or restrictions on it);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: section 20(2) (refusing to issue or temporarily withholding the issue of a certificate of inspection);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: section 24(2) (imposing conditions or restrictions on a certificate of survey);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: section 24(3) (amending or revoking conditions or restrictions imposed on a certificate of survey, or imposing new conditions or restrictions on it);

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: section 25(1) (refusing to issue or temporarily withholding the issue of a certificate of survey);

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: section 28(1) (cancelling or suspending a certificate of inspection or certificate of survey);

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: section 62(1) (imposing conditions or restrictions on a survey record of safety equipment, HKLL certificate, FA certificate or declaration of fitness);

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: section 62(2) (amending or revoking conditions or restrictions imposed on a survey record of safety equipment, HKLL certificate, FA certificate or declaration of fitness, or imposing new conditions or restrictions on it);

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: section 64(1) (refusing to issue or temporarily withholding the issue of a survey record of safety equipment, HKLL certificate, FA certificate or declaration of fitness);

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: section 66(1) (cancelling or suspending a survey record of safety equipment, HKLL certificate, FA certificate or declaration of fitness).

subsection.leadIn: An appeal under subsection (1) shall be made within 14 days after the following date— (L.N. 265 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a decision referred to in subsection (1)(a), (c), (d), (f), (g), (h), (j), (k) or (l), the date on which the person aggrieved has received notice of the decision; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a decision referred to in subsection (1)(b), (e) or (i), the date on which the person aggrieved has received the certificate, survey record or declaration concerned.

subsection.content: Unless it is in the opinion of the Director inappropriate to do so, an appeal under subsection (1) shall not render a decision that is appealed against ineffective.

section.name: s87
section.heading: Amendment of Schedules
section.content: The Director may, by notice in the Gazette, amend any of the Schedules.

section.name: s88
section.heading: Transitional arrangements
section.content: The transitional provisions specified in Schedule 8 have effect.

section.name: s89
section.heading: Transitional provision relating to Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (Safety and Survey) (Amendment) Regulation 2019

subsection.content: During the transitional period, a local vessel that complies with the former requirements is taken to be in compliance with the new requirements.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: amending Regulation (《修訂規例》) means the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (Safety and Survey) (Amendment) Regulation 2019 (L.N. 154 of 2019); (E.R. 4 of 2024)
transitional period (過渡期) means the period of 2 years beginning on 23 December 2019.

section.def: extreme breadth (最大寬度), in relation to a local vessel, means the athwartship distance between the extremity of the outermost permanent structure on the port side and the extremity of the outermost permanent structure on the starboard side of the vessel.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Replacement of life-saving appliances
section.content: Where a life-saving appliance on a local vessel is marked with an expiry date, the appliance shall be replaced on or before that date.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Operational readiness and maintenance of life-saving appliances
section.leadIn: Whenever a local vessel is being used or operated, every life-saving appliance carried on board the vessel shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in working order;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ready for immediate use; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: placed in a position easily accessible.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Provision of lifebuoys

subsection.content: For the purposes of assessing the adequacy of life-saving appliances on board a local vessel, each lifebuoy is taken to be for use by 2 persons on board the vessel.
A lifebuoy may be fitted with a buoyant lifeline or self-igniting light, but not both.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Provision of lifejackets

subsection.content: A local vessel must carry on board the required quantity of lifejackets.

If there are any persons on board the vessel, the lifejackets carried on board (excluding infant lifejackets) must include at least 1 suitable lifejacket for each person on board, excluding a person for whom the suitable lifejacket is an infant lifejacket.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: a Class II vessel that is licensed as—

subparagraph.content: a landing platform;
a landing pontoon; or
a stationary vessel that is a separation barge; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a floating restaurant to which section 7 of this Schedule applies.

subsection.leadIn: This section also does not apply to a local vessel if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the operating licence of the vessel restricts it to plying within specified sheltered waters or a typhoon shelter;

paragraph.name: b
c
d
paragraph.content: the quantity of the lifejackets is not less than 50% of the permitted number of persons.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: permitted number of persons (獲允許人數), in relation to a local vessel, means the total number of persons the vessel is permitted to carry under the conditions of its operating licence;
required quantity of lifejackets (規定數量的救生衣), in relation to a local vessel, means a quantity of lifejackets (excluding infant lifejackets) that is not less than the permitted number of persons.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Provision of infant lifejackets

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a

subparagraph.content: is let for hire or reward; and
is permitted to carry more than 12 passengers under the conditions of its operating licence.

subsection.content: The vessel must carry on board a quantity of infant lifejackets that is not less than 2.5% of the permitted number of passengers.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (2)—
subsection.def: permitted number of passengers (獲允許乘客人數), in relation to a Class I vessel or Class IV vessel, means the total number of passengers the vessel is permitted to carry under the conditions of its operating licence.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Provision of lifejackets and infant lifejackets on floating restaurants

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a floating restaurant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the operating licence of which restricts the floating restaurant to plying or operating within specified sheltered waters or a typhoon shelter; and

subparagraph.content: is attached to the shore and is provided with adequate gangways; or

subparagraph.leadIn: is not attached to the shore but is provided with—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: above-water flotation in the form of a steel embarkation pontoon moored alongside; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: steel tenders at both ends capable of being towed to a safe place away from the floating restaurant.

subsection.content: The floating restaurant must carry on board a quantity of lifejackets (excluding infant lifejackets) that is not less than 50% of the permitted number of persons.

subsection.leadIn: However, the floating restaurant may, instead of complying with subsection (2), carry on board a combination of lifejackets and lifebuoys that is adequate for 50% of the permitted number of persons but only if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the quantity of the lifejackets is not less than 25% of the permitted number of persons.

subsection.content: In addition to complying with subsection (2) or (3), the floating restaurant must also carry on board a quantity of infant lifejackets that is not less than 1.25% of the permitted number of passengers.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: permitted number of persons (獲允許人數) has the meaning given by section 5(5) of this Schedule.

schedule.name: sch4
schedule.heading: Fire Protection and Provision of Fire-fighting Apparatus

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Schedule, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: cargo pump room (貨泵房) means a room in which any pump used for loading, discharging or transferring cargoes is located;
engine room (輪機室) means a space which contains propulsion machinery and generators;
machinery space (機艙) means a space which contains internal combustion engines, electrical machinery, ventilation and air conditioning machinery and any similar space;

service space (服務艙) include galleys, pantries containing cooking appliances, lockers and store rooms, workshops (other than those forming part of machinery spaces) and any similar space and any trunk to such space.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Operation and installation requirement

subsection.leadIn: Where a local vessel is required by this Schedule to be provided with fire pumps operated by power—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.leadIn: unless otherwise specified in this Schedule, such fire pumps shall be— (L.N. 187 of 2016)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: driven by means other than the vessel’s main engines; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: capable of delivering at least one jet of water from any hydrant provided in the vessel while simultaneously maintaining sufficient pressure; and

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: arrangements shall be made to ensure immediate availability of a water supply from the fire main at the appropriate pressure by suitably placed remote starting of the fire pumps, unless the machinery space is continually manned.

subsection.leadIn: The following pumps are fire pumps that comply with this Schedule—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: sanitary pumps;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: ballast pumps;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: bilge pumps; or

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: general service pumps.

subsection.content: Where a local vessel is required by this Schedule to be provided with apparatus capable of delivering one jet of water, sufficient number of hydrants shall be so positioned on the vessel as to deliver one jet of water from a single length of hose to reach any part of the vessel.

subsection.leadIn: Whenever a local vessel is being used or operated, every fire-fighting apparatus carried on board the vessel shall be—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: in working order;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: ready for immediate use; and

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: placed in a position easily accessible.

subsection.leadIn: All portable fire-fighting apparatus (other than the firemen’s outfits) carried on board a local vessel shall be—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: arranged in accordance with the relevant plans approved under Part 3 of this Regulation; and

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: placed in a position where they will be easily accessible from the spaces in which they are intended to be used and, in particular, one of the portable fire extinguishers intended to be used in any space shall be placed near the entrance to that space.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: A flat-top work barge, a landing pontoon and any other type of local vessel having no engine, oil fuel tank, electrical switchboard and combustible materials on board is not required to be provided with any fire-fighting apparatus.

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: A local vessel that is used or to be used for carrying any dangerous goods other than oil shall be provided with such additional fire-fighting apparatus as the Director may specify in writing.

subsection.content: The requirement for a local vessel of 75 m or more in length shall be specified by the Director on a case-by-case basis.
For a Class II vessel that falls within paragraph (b) of Schedule 2, instead of the fire-fighting apparatus stated in the Table, at least 1 fire bucket with lanyard is required. (L.N. 154 of 2019)
For Class II Category B vessels and Class IV vessels, if a fire main is provided, then no fire bucket is required. (L.N. 70 of 2020)
The fire pump and its sea suction shall be situated outside the engine room.
The fire pump may be propulsion engine driven, provided it can be readily engaged to the engine.
Only for a Class II vessel that is fitted with any propulsion engine.

subsection.leadIn: A Class II vessel of 24 m or more in length shall be provided with the following additional appliances—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: 1 hydrant in each engine room; and

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: 1 spray nozzle on each deck and in each engine room.

subsection.leadIn: For a fishing sampan made of glass reinforced plastic, only the following fire-fighting apparatus are required—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the sampan is less than 8 m in length, 1 portable dry powder fire extinguisher that has a capacity of not less than 2.7 kg of dry powder and 1 fire bucket with lanyard; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the sampan is 8 m or more in length, 2 portable dry powder fire extinguishers each of a capacity of not less than 2.7 kg of dry powder and 2 fire buckets with lanyard.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: For a Class III vessel that falls within paragraph (a) of Schedule 2, instead of the fire-fighting apparatus stated in the Table, the following apparatus is required—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at least 1 portable dry powder fire extinguisher that has a capacity of not less than 1.25 kg of dry powder;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at least 1 fire bucket with lanyard. (L.N. 154 of 2019)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: For a Class III vessel that falls within paragraph (b) of Schedule 2, instead of the fire-fighting apparatus stated in the Table, at least 1 fire bucket with lanyard is required. (L.N. 154 of 2019)
The requirement for a Class III vessel of 45 m or more in length shall be specified by the Director on a case-by-case basis.
The fire pump may be propulsion engine driven, provided it can be readily engaged to the engine.

subsection.leadIn: Applicable to a Class III vessel that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: holds a valid port clearance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is exempted under section 69(1) of the Ordinance from complying with section 28(1) of the Ordinance.

subsection.content: Requirements in angle brackets (“< >”) are for new vessels only.
An engine room that contains internal combustion type machinery having in aggregate a total power output of not less than 375 kW shall be provided with at least one dual purpose nozzle.
The fire detection and alarm system may be waived, provided the location of the machinery space facilitates the detection of fire by persons on board.

subsection.content: Two extinguishers should be provided if there is a galley on board.
For engine room that contains internal combustion type machinery having in aggregate a total power output of not less than 375 kW.
Fire buckets may be substituted by an equal number of portable dry powder fire extinguishers each of a capacity of not less than 4.5 kg of dry powder or equivalent.
The fire pump and its sea suction shall be situated outside the engine room.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Position of marks
section.content: On receiving particulars of the assigned freeboard, the owner of the Class II vessel concerned or his agent shall cause to be marked on each side of the vessel, to the satisfaction of the Director or competent surveyor, the appropriate marks in accordance with this Schedule.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Method of marking
section.content: The lines described in section 3 shall be marked in such a manner as to make them plainly visible. They shall be painted in white or yellow on a dark background or in black on a light background, and shall be carefully cut in or centre punched.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Details of marks
section.text: A Class II vessel to which this Part applies shall be marked on each side at amidships, with a deck line and freeboard line as follows—

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: The deck line shall be a horizontal line of 300 mm in length and 25 mm in breadth marked amidships with its upper edge passing through the point where the continuation outwards of the upper surface of the freeboard deck intersects the outer surface of the shell. Where the deck is partly sheathed amidships, the upper edge of the deck line shall pass through the point where the continuation outwards of the upper surface of the actual sheathing at amidships intersects the outer surface of the shell.

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: The horizontal freeboard line shall be 380 mm in length and 25 mm in breadth, and 2 additional lines each 75 mm in length and 25 mm in breadth, shall be located with their upper edges at distances of 150 mm, one above, and one below, the upper edge of the horizontal freeboard line. All horizontal lines shall be at right angles to a vertical line 325 mm in depth and 25 mm in width which bisects the horizontal lines.

subsection.name: c
subsection.content: The assigned freeboard shall be measured from the upper edge of the deck line to the upper edge of the horizontal freeboard line.

repealed Launches and Ferry Vessels Regulations (已廢除的《小輪及渡輪船隻規例》) means the Merchant Shipping (Launches and Ferry Vessels) Regulations (Cap. 313 sub. leg. E) repealed under section 91(1) of the Ordinance;
repealed Miscellaneous Craft Regulations (已廢除的《雜類航行器規例》) means the Merchant Shipping (Miscellaneous Craft) Regulations (Cap. 313 sub. leg. F) repealed under section 91(1) of the Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Arrangement in respect of previously issued certificates of inspection and certificates of survey

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

subparagraph.name: a
b
subparagraph.content: a certificate of survey issued under any of the provisions of the repealed Launches and Ferry Vessels Regulations,

subsection.continued: that was in force immediately before the relevant day.

subsection.content: A certificate to which this section applies shall be regarded as a certificate of survey issued under section 24(1) of this Regulation in respect of the local vessel to which it relates during the remainder of its period of validity, and the provisions of this Regulation shall apply accordingly.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Deferred application of section 16 of this Regulation on certain Class IV vessels

subsection.content: Section 16(1)(a) of this Regulation shall not apply to a Class IV vessel that falls within section 15(2)(b) of this Regulation in the 12 months after the relevant day.

subsection.leadIn: Section 16(1)(b) of this Regulation shall not apply to a Class IV vessel—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: that is not a new vessel; and

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: that falls within section 15(2)(a), (c) or (d) of this Regulation,

subsection.continued: in the 12 months after the relevant day.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Arrangement in respect of previously issued survey records of safety equipment

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a written document titled “Survey Record—Safety Equipment”—

subparagraph.name: a
b
subparagraph.content: that was in force immediately before the relevant day.

subsection.content: A document to which this section applies shall be regarded as a survey record of safety equipment issued under section 39 of this Regulation in respect of the Class II vessel to which it relates during the remainder of its period of validity, and the provisions of this Regulation shall apply accordingly.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Deferred application of Division 2 of Part 5 of this Regulation on certain Class II vessels
section.leadIn: Section 35(1) of this Regulation shall not apply to a Class II vessel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to which Division 2 of Part 5 of this Regulation applies; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that does not have a document that falls within section 4 in force in respect of it on the relevant day,

section.continued: in the 12 months after the relevant day.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Arrangement in respect of previously issued assignment of freeboard certificates

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to an assignment of freeboard certificate—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: issued under regulation 45B(2)(b) of the repealed Miscellaneous Craft Regulations; and

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: that was in force immediately before the relevant day.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), a certificate to which this section applies shall be regarded as a FA certificate issued under section 46 of this Regulation in respect of the Class II vessel to which it relates during the remainder of its period of validity, and the provisions of this Regulation shall apply accordingly.

Regulation 45C of the repealed Miscellaneous Craft Regulations that was in force immediately before the relevant day shall continue to apply to a Class II vessel that falls within subsection (2), and the owner of such vessel or his agent shall, at the request of the Director, pay the appropriate fee prescribed in the relevant fee regulation in respect of any periodical inspection under that regulation 45C.

subsection.def: In subsection (3), relevant fee regulation (有關費用規例) means the Merchant Shipping (Fees) Regulations (Cap. 281 sub. leg. F) that were in force immediately before the relevant day.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Deferred application of section 42(1) of this Regulation on certain Class II vessels
section.leadIn: Section 42(1) of this Regulation shall not apply to a Class II vessel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to which Part 6 of this Regulation applies; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that is not a new vessel or dumb lighter,

section.continued: in the 12 months after the relevant day.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Arrangement in respect of previously issued declarations or granted permissions for carriage of dangerous goods

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: a declaration issued under regulation 34(1)(a) of the repealed Miscellaneous Craft Regulations; or

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: a permission granted under regulation 12(1) of the Dangerous Goods (Shipping) Regulations (Cap. 295 sub. leg. C),

subsection.continued: that was in force immediately before the relevant day.

subsection.content: A declaration or permission to which this section applies shall be regarded as a declaration of fitness issued under section 54 of this Regulation in respect of the local vessel to which it relates during the remainder of its period of validity, and the provisions of this Regulation shall apply accordingly.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Deferred application of certain requirements in Schedules 3 and 4 to this Regulation

subsection.content: During the 12 months after the relevant day, section 32(2)(b) of this Regulation shall not apply to a local vessel to which Table 1 in Part 2 of Schedule 3 to this Regulation applies in so far as the provision of lifejacket on board the vessel in accordance with the Table is concerned.

During the 12 months after the relevant day, section 33(2)(b) of this Regulation shall not apply to a local vessel to which Table 1 in Part 2 of Schedule 4 to this Regulation applies in so far as the provision of emergency fire pump on board the vessel in accordance with the Table is concerned.

During the 12 months after the relevant day, section 33(2)(b) of this Regulation shall not apply to an oil carrier to which Table 6 in Part 2 of Schedule 4 to this Regulation applies in so far as the provision of main fire pump and emergency fire pump on board the oil carrier in accordance with the Table is concerned.
